item.title: PricewaterhouseCoopers to Pour $1 Billion Into Generative AI
item.description: Multiyear investment in U.S. business includes accessing ChatGPT maker OpenAI’s language model, training staff in AI capabilities.

item.title: Cyber Chiefs Forge Partnerships With Physical Security Units As Combined Threats Grow
item.description: AI can help identify potential cyber-physical attacks, says Schneider Electric CIO Elizabeth Hackenson.

item.title: U.S., South Korea Pledge Cooperation on Nuclear Arms
item.description: Seoul has agreed not to develop its own arsenal in exchange for more of a say in planning a potential American nuclear response to a North Korean attack.

item.title: Schools Are Ditching Homework, Deadlines in Favor of 'Equitable Grading'
item.description: The changes aim to measure mastery and account for hardships at home, though teachers say some students are gaming the system.

item.title: So Many Ways to Communicate at Work, So Many Ways to Misfire
item.description: Workplaces have become saturated with ways to talk, often breeding mistakes and misunderstandings.

item.title: SPACs Delivered Easy Money, Now Companies Are Running Out
item.description: The SPAC boom took hundreds of risky companies to the stock market. The next stop for many is bankruptcy court.

item.title: Midwest Cities Topped WSJ Housing Index in First Quarter
item.description: Lafayette, Ind., led the index for the second consecutive quarter.

item.title: See Full Rankings for WSJ/Realtor.com's Spring Emerging Housing Markets Index
item.description: Here is how metro areas across the U.S. stack up in the newly updated spring 2023 rankings.

item.title: Korea's Stock Market Shines Even as Economy Dims
item.description: Should a slowing economy lead to a weak stock market? Not judging by the performance of Korea’s benchmark index this year.

item.title: Sometimes It's Not the Airline's Fault. It's Yours.
item.description: Botched reservations or failed passport renewals can happen to even the savviest travelers.

item.title: Meta Expected to Report Fourth Straight Quarterly Sales Drop
item.description: The Facebook parent is facing weak advertiser demand and privacy headwinds.

item.title: GOP's Debt-Ceiling Proposal: Where Do Republicans Want to Cut Spending?
item.description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy plans vote on the Limit, Save, Grow Act soon, hoping to spark talks with President Biden.

item.title: Riksbank Lifts Rate; Slower Hike Pace Likely
item.description: Sweden’s central bank raised its key policy rate to 3.5% as expected, and signalled a further smaller hike later in the year as it continues to fight stubbornly high inflation.

item.title: FTSE 100 Falls as Traders Digest Earnings
item.description: The FTSE 100 was down 0.5% as investors waded through numerous corporate earnings, with CRH a big faller after the building materials group said the European backdrop remained challenging amid inflation pressures and some slowdown in the new-build residential sector.

item.title: Euro Bond Yields Expected to Remain in Recent Ranges
item.description: The portfolios of Generali’s euro bond strategies are tactically positioned between defensive and neutral after the recent rates movements and it said euro yields should move in range in the weeks ahead.

item.title: Copper Prices Look Well Supported in Longer Run
item.description: Copper prices are likely well supported in the longer run, even though growing concerns over global recession risks weigh on sentiment, Saxo Bank said.

item.title: Oil Edges Higher But Economic Concerns Linger
item.description: Oil futures gained around 0.5% in Europe as a stronger-than-expected drop in U.S. inventories helped halt the recent slide in prices, but ANZ said a slump in refining margins was weighing on sentiment.

item.title: Swedish Krona Turns Weaker After Rate Decision
item.description: The Swedish krona turned lower after the Riksbank raised its key interest rate by 50 basis points to 3.5%, as widely expected, but signalled it would slow the pace of rises at upcoming meetings.

item.title: GSK Profit, Sales Beat Views; Backs Outlook
item.description: GSK confirmed its 2023 guidance after it reported first-quarter net profit and sales above expectations but that declined on year due to lower sales of Covid-19 treatments.

item.title: Puma Sees Profit Headwinds Continuing
item.description: Puma confirmed its outlook for the year, but warned of continued drags on profitability after its first quarter underlying earnings fell to €176 million, and said sales growth should slow in the second quarter before picking up in the second half of the year.
